channel.title: Power Automate on Microsoft 365 Community Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Power Automate on Microsoft 365 Community Blog

item.title: How to rename files in SharePoint with Power Automate
item.description: Although SharePoint and Power Automate are heavily interwoven, there is no “rename file” action in Power Automate - if the file lives in a SharePoint library.

item.title: Migrate Cloud Flows and Canvas Apps across tenants
item.description: Introduction If you are a Power App or Power Automate developer, chances are you had to move your creations between SharePoint sites or even Microsoft 365 tenants.

item.title: How to create a custom connector for your own Azure hosted API
item.description: In this blog post I am going to cover: How to create an API with JavaScript, How to deploy this to Azure, How to wrap the API into a custom connector, How to use the connector in Power Apps

item.title: Comparing two arrays without an apply to each?
item.description: I have two arrays in Power Automate, whilst very similar in structure (key/value pairs) the unique ID for both arrays is named differently (id vs PersonId) but I want to compare both and return only those that do not appear in the Array 1.

item.title: Microsoft Forms as a Tab in Teams using graph API in Power Automate
item.description: This article is focused on how you can add Forms as a Website Tab in Microsoft Teams using Post Tab in Teams channel graph API

item.title: Adaptive Cards community call – January 2022
item.description: The following topics are covered in this month’s community call: Adaptive Cards and the Power Platform to solve captchas (Use RPA, Adaptive Cards actionable messaging and Power Automate to resolve captcha challenges remotely on desktop or mobile) - Tomasz Poszytek (MVP), Website Updates (Blog posts for previous community calls, new samples for all 1.5 features!) - J.P. Roca (Microsoft) and Q&A – members of the Developer and PM teams fielded questions on a host of topics for the last 15 minutes on this call. This call was hosted by J.P. Roca (Microsoft). Recorded on January 13, 2022.

item.title: Using Power Automate flow API in your SPFx solution
item.description: What’s it all about Ever needed a small feature in your webpart to show a list of flows from Power Automate or maybe show a history of one specific flow or maybe disable/enable a flow straight from you SPFx solution?

item.title: How to Convert Word Document to PDF in SharePoint Document Library using Power Automate?
item.description: Introduction In this article, we will see how to convert a Word Document to PDF in SharePoint Document Library using Power Automate without using any license version.

item.title: How 3 makers, 2 devs and a princess came together to save kittens for a hackathon
item.description: The Story (Michael) Just before Southcoast Summit 2021 got started, the organizers hosted the Automate Everything - SS2021 Hackathon where every solution revolves around Flic buttons.

item.title: Hiding the SharePoint page title with Power Automate
item.description: For any SharePoint modern page that you create manually, there will always be a page title that you cannot remove using the SharePoint UI at the moment.

item.title: Create Site Script and Site Template Using Power Automate in SharePoint
item.description: Introduction Many times, the Site is already created, and we need to apply configuration in the existing site to achieve some level of consistency.

item.title: Create Report Of Assigned Licenses To Users From Microsoft 365
item.description: Introduction Power Automate is a tool that enables you to implement queries without knowing hardcore coding patterns.

item.title: Create and Retrieve Power Automate Flows - WITH CODE!!! :-)
item.description: As you are probably aware, Microsoft is looking to eliminate SharePoint 2010 and 2013 workflows.

item.title: Excel File Tricks with PowerAutomate
item.description: A little secret First of all, if you don’t know already and you want to quickly create an excel or word file on your OneDrive, try http://excel.

item.title: How to break and change list item permission using Power Automate?
item.description: Introduction In this article, we will see a step-by-step implementation of how to break and change list item permission using Power Automate.

item.title: How to use Send an HTTP request to SharePoint in Power Automate?
item.description: Introduction Send an HTTP request to SharePoint action is used to execute REST queries.

item.title: Excel Scripts and Cloud Flows - Data Manipulation
item.description: Have you discovered that the existing Power Automate actions for Excel are limited to Excel Tables?

item.title: Export Power Apps and Power Automate user licenses
item.description: Context During a Power Platform audit for a customer, I was looking for exporting all user licenses data into a single file to analyze it with Power BI.

item.title: Avoid Unnecessary Looping (Apply to each) in Power Automate
item.description: Use Case Often you want to retrieve just one item in a SharePoint list and then display the value of a property from it.

item.title: Fully leverage the possibilities of the dev tenant
item.description: Now let’s imagine this. You have the developer tenant from your Microsoft 365 Developer Subscription, and you enrolled the Power Apps Community Plan with it, so you have the full range of possibilities on your dev tenant, right?

item.title: Create and add a OneNote tab to your Microsoft Teams team channel using Power Automate + Graph API
item.description: I was asked to share how I have been adding new OneNote tabs to a team channel in Microsoft Teams using Power Automate + Graph API.

item.title: How to enhance your "dev tenant" to unleash the full potential of the Power Platform
item.description: The Microsoft 365 Developer tenant is an amazing feature to learn and experiment in the Microsoft 365 universe (actually I’m talking about your personal development “sandbox” of the Microsoft 365 developer program.

item.title: How to use a custom connector in Power Automate
item.description: Power Automate is a super cool tool, which gives us a lot of options.

item.title: How to use Parse JSON action in Power Automate
item.description: We can see a a lot of JSON in our Power Automate flow run history, and if you wonder, how you can parse JSON to make Dynamic Content (which is selectable) out of it so you can more easily make use of an object, then this post is made for you.

item.title: How to transition from Power Automate to Logic Apps
item.description: Introduction Hello, are you looking to understand the differences between Power Automate and Azure Logic Apps – or not sure what each of these does and when to use them?

item.title: Get your To Do tasks daily in Teams using Power Automate
item.description: This blog post is inspired by Ayca Bas’s excellent blog post on this subject using Azure Logic Apps instead of Power Automate
